snippet: Insurgents dealt a serious blow to a battalion in eastern Afghanistan on Friday, killing 13 soldiers and overrunning their outpost.
abstract: Taliban insurgents deal serious blow to one of Afghan Army’s most highly regarded units, killing 13 soldiers and overrunning their remote outpost in eastern Afghanistan; Afghan soldiers and police officers are dying at more than double the rate of one year ago.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul, and an Afghan employee of The New York Times from Kunar Province.

lead_paragraph: Insurgents dealt a serious blow to a battalion in eastern Afghanistan on Friday, killing 13 soldiers and overrunning their outpost.

headline.main: Taliban Attack Highly Regarded Afghan Army Unit
headline.print_headline: Taliban Attack Highly Regarded Afghan Army Unit
